job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a Research Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release. You will also have extensive knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and Generative AI domain.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, STABLE DIFFUSION and more - and you love large data and large compute, then we would love to talk to you.

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our foundational model for video generation based on large video data-sets. You will also help build the academic contributions in this area. In this role you will be conducting cutting edge research, pushing the boundaries and going beyond existing SOTA solutions. This would include:
     * Reviewing specialised literature on text to video / video synthesis.
     * Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
     * Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
     * Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam
job_details.full_text:
Research Engineer - Video Diffusion

We are looking for a Research Engineer, with passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.

   Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!

        You will be someone who loves to code and build working systems. You are used to working in a fast-paced start-up environment. You will have experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release. You will also have extensive knowledge and experience in Computer Vision and Generative AI domain.

       You will join a group of more than 40 Engineers in the R&D department and will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, our R&D research is guided by our co-founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.

   If you know and love DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, STABLE DIFFUSION and more - and you love large data and large compute, then we would love to talk to you.

What will you be doing?

     In this position, you'll join the team to help develop our foundational model for video generation based on large video data-sets. You will also help build the academic contributions in this area. In this role you will be conducting cutting edge research, pushing the boundaries and going beyond existing SOTA solutions. This would include:
     * Reviewing specialised literature on text to video / video synthesis.
     * Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
     * Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
     * Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
     * Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
     * Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
     * Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
     * Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions., You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in Amsterdam

profile_classification.rationale: The role heavily emphasizes developing foundational models for video generation using generative AI techniques, specifically text-to-video. It involves adapting off-the-shelf solutions, optimizing prototypes for deployment, and working with large datasets and compute, aligning with the core responsibilities of a GenAI Engineer.

phrases.text: Our aim is to make video content creation available for all - not only to studio production!
phrases.justification: This phrase describes the overarching goal and market impact of the technology being developed, indicating an understanding of the business objective.

phrases.text: Designing the requirements, project scoping and owning the roadmap in your area.
phrases.justification: This involves defining project scope, requirements, and future direction, which are key aspects of understanding business needs and translating them into technical plans.

phrases.text: Managing the progress of the Large Video Model project and making sure that it is in line with our vision.
phrases.justification: This task requires aligning technical project progress with the company's strategic vision and goals.

phrases.text: develop our foundational model for video generation based on large video data-sets.
phrases.justification: This implies working with and processing large datasets, which is a fundamental aspect of data engineering for model training.

phrases.text: large data and large compute
phrases.justification: This phrase directly refers to the scale of data that needs to be handled and processed for model development.

phrases.text: create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video.
phrases.justification: This describes the core generative modeling task of creating synthetic media from text prompts.

phrases.text: text-to-video
phrases.justification: This is a specific generative modeling task focused on creating video content from textual descriptions.

phrases.text: Computer Vision and Generative AI domain.
phrases.justification: This explicitly mentions the domain of expertise required, which is central to generative modeling.

phrases.text: If you know and love DALL.E, MUSE, IMAGEN, MAKE-A-VIDEO, STABLE DIFFUSION and more
phrases.justification: These are all well-known generative AI models, indicating a focus on working with and developing similar models.

phrases.text: develop our foundational model for video generation
phrases.justification: This directly refers to the creation and development of a core generative model.

phrases.text: Reviewing specialised literature on text to video / video synthesis.
phrases.justification: This involves understanding the state-of-the-art in generative modeling for video.

phrases.text: pushing the boundaries and going beyond existing SOTA solutions.
phrases.justification: This implies research and development in advanced modeling techniques.

phrases.text: Adapting off-the-shelf solutions for the purposes of our product.
phrases.justification: This involves fine-tuning or adapting existing generative models for specific use cases.

phrases.text: love to code and build working systems.
phrases.justification: This indicates a strong focus on practical software development and building functional systems.

phrases.text: experience with the software development life cycle, from ideation through implementation, to testing and release.
phrases.justification: This explicitly mentions the full software development lifecycle.

phrases.text: Building libraries to accelerate our iteration speed during development (abstracting common functionality, automating tests sweeps, visualising results etc.).
phrases.justification: This involves creating software components and tools to support the development process.

phrases.text: Developing production quality software
phrases.justification: This highlights the need to build robust, high-quality software.

phrases.text: our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world.
phrases.justification: This implies building end-to-end software solutions that reach users.

phrases.text: turning prototypes into working solutions.
phrases.justification: This is a core software development task of taking research outputs and making them functional products.

phrases.text: Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment.
phrases.justification: This covers the entire lifecycle of an ML model, including deployment and maintenance, which is central to MLOps.

phrases.text: Optimising for deployment - turning prototypes into working solutions.
phrases.justification: This involves preparing models and software for production environments and ensuring they function correctly in deployment.

owning the roadmap in your area
